intro: Aeschynomene warmingii, commonly known as the Brazilian burrgrass, is a low-growing perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, tropical environments. Aeschynomene warmingii is also valued for its potential in soil stabilization and as a forage crop.
